quote.text: Lift as heavy as possible, as much volume as possible, while remaining as fresh as possible.
quote.author: Steve Freides

what.title: StrongCode
what.description: StrongCode is built on the Plan Strong™ methodology — the programming system developed from Soviet weightlifting research. Volume and intensity are planned across months, weeks, and sessions according to specific distribution principles. The result: continuous strength gains without grinding yourself into the ground.

who.title: Who is it for
who.description: This is not a beginner program. StrongCode is for lifters who have plateaued on linear progression and need smarter programming to keep moving forward:
who.point1: Have mastered proper technique in their chosen lifts
who.point2: Have established baseline 1RMs that haven't improved on linear progression
who.point3: Want to break through plateaus in any of these lifts:

expect.title: What to expect
expect.paragraph1: Expect steady progress over months, not dramatic peaks followed by burnout. You will rarely train to failure. You will lift heavy weights more often than you're used to — but leave the gym feeling capable of more.
expect.paragraph2: Can we promise exceptional results? No. Outcomes depend on many factors outside the program.
expect.paragraph3: Results depend on recovery. Sleep, stress management, and nutrition matter — the program can't fix those for you.

tailored.title: Individually Tailored
tailored.description: Your program is calculated from your numbers — current 1RMs, training history, recovery capacity, available time. Two lifters with different profiles will get different programs. There are no templates.

unique.title: Unique
unique.paragraph1: If you've only trained with fixed set × rep schemes, this will look different. Volume and intensity vary between sessions, weeks, and months — sometimes dramatically.
unique.point1: High variability of volume (between sessions, weeks, and months)
unique.point2: Volume and intensity are planned independently
unique.point3: Multiple intensity zones in each workout
unique.paragraph3: In a single session, you might work at 65%, 80%, and 90%. The volume at each zone shifts from session to session and week to week according to distribution rules — not randomly.

joyful.title: Variety
joyful.description: You won't do the same workout twice in a training block. The variability is built into the system.

longterm.title: Long term
longterm.paragraph1: If you provide correct data, you should never train to failure. This alone significantly lowers the probability of injuries.
longterm.paragraph2: Volume waves up and down across weeks. This prevents the accumulation of fatigue that eventually stops progress on most programs.

hypertrophy.title: Hypertrophy?
hypertrophy.description: Want more muscle? We shift the parameters. Want pure strength? Different settings. The system adapts to your goal.

benefits.title: Benefits
benefits.point1: Flexible scheduling — sessions can be moved within a week, weeks within a month.
benefits.point2: Variety of rep ranges at a given load removes psychological barriers associated with heavy weights.
benefits.point3: Submaximal efforts. High volume without grinding.
benefits.point6: Frequent heavy singles build confidence and consistency.
benefits.point7: You stay close to your peak year-round. When you need to perform, the taper is short.

inputs.paragraph1: You fill out a detailed questionnaire. We collect your 1RMs, training history, volume tolerance, recovery capacity, schedule constraints. From this data, program parameters are calculated.
inputs.paragraph2: The numbers come from calculations. The program comes from the coach — someone who has built hundreds of these plans and knows what works.

result.paragraph1: Minimum program length is 2 months: preparatory phase plus peak.
result.paragraph2: Longer prep phases (3+ months) produce better results — more time to build strength before peaking.

beginners.title: Why not for beginners?
beginners.description: For beginners, progress is largely a function of weight on the bar. The programming is simple: keep volume steady, add weight. As you advance, progress depends more on volume and its distribution across sessions, weeks, and months. The more advanced you are, the more programming matters. That's where this system earns its value.

model.title: Linear, wave, and dynamic model
model.description: Linear and wave periodization tie volume and intensity together inversely. In StrongCode, they're independent. This allows combinations that traditional models can't produce.

factors.title: What we track
factors.paragraph1: Programming decisions are based on measurable variables across different time scales.
factors.point1: volume per year / month / week / session
factors.point2: average intensity per year / month / week / session
factors.point3: distribution of the volume between months / in a month / week / session
factors.point4: distribution of the average intensity between months / in a month / week / session

dynamics.title: Training Dynamics
dynamics.paragraph1: Volume and intensity change throughout the training cycle. The changes are calculated based on your profile.
dynamics.paragraph2: Both volume and average intensity vary:
dynamics.point1: Each workout is different — heavy, moderate, and light weights with varying volumes.
dynamics.point2: Volume shifts can be dramatic. Week 1: high, week 2: low, week 3: high, week 4: moderate.
dynamics.point3: Long-term progression is designed to peak when it matters — competition or a PR attempt.
dynamics.keyTakeaway: The variation follows rules. It's not random.

ladders.title: Why do we use ladders so extensively?
ladders.description: Because ladders are great to manage high volumes and at the same time keep neural and metabolic fatigue low.

base.title: Base Price
base.amount: 39 USD / EUR per lift per month
base.example1: 2 month program for 3 powerlifts: 39×3×2 = 234 USD / EUR
base.example2: 3 month program for 3 powerlifts: 39×3×3 = 351 USD / EUR

vision.title: Vision
vision.description: Programs are calculated first, then reviewed and adjusted by a coach. Numbers plus experience.

cta.title: Interested?
cta.description: Fill out the survey. We'll review your numbers and get back to you.

survey.title: Initial Survey
survey.subtitle: Be Strong Advanced Survey
survey.description: This survey helps us understand your current level and create an optimal training program for you. It takes approximately 10-15 minutes to complete.

survey.footer: After submission, your data will be securely stored and we will contact you soon.
